summary: For any fan of Michael Sheen, the instagram of his daughter (@lily_sheen) and her mom (@katebeckinsale) are a great source of...
body:
For any fan of Michael Sheen, the instagram of his daughter (@lily_sheen) and her mom (@katebeckinsale) are a great source of hilarious (and adorable) gems.

Apparently they both like to tease him and ship him with Jamie Campbell-Bower/Caius 😂

reblog.comment:

blog.name: eastorhild
blog.title: I get these ideas, you know
blog.description:
...and so I got one of these Tumblrs. During the day I’m a grumpy secretary, but when the night falls, I become an idealist militant hippie Sherlockian who REALLY likes things. Hi. 
If you have tag wishes, let me know. I tag almost everything anyway.
Regarding BBC Sherlock: This blog is mostly a Sherlock positive blog. I am still a bit confused about s4 and sometimes salty, but I love the series and I really hope they will still make series 5.

If you are a porn blog wanting to follow me, welcome to my block list. (Please go away.)

summary: So, I started watching Masters of Sex, thanks to @aziraphale-is-ace, and I can honestly say that I have fallen for Michael...
body: So, I started watching Masters of Sex, thanks to @aziraphale-is-ace, and I can honestly say that I have fallen for Michael Sheen. He is so wonderfully fantastic! The way that he plays Bill Masters is so different from every other character I’ve seen him portray. It’s fucking amazing!!

tags: the ocean at the end of the lane
summary: Michael Sheen read 'The Ocean at the End of the Lane' for BBC radio 4's Book at Bedtime (an abridged version, not the full...
question: Michael Sheen read 'The Ocean at the End of the Lane' for BBC radio 4's Book at Bedtime (an abridged version, not the full book.) It's probably still available to listen to on the BBC website somewhere?
answer:
Hm. I looked, but it’s showing the episodes as no longer available, and a search on YouTube came up empty as well. I would think that’s something they would keep available, especially since dramatizations of Gaiman’s books are popular.

(Send me an Ask)

reblog.comment:

Hm. I looked, but it’s showing the episodes as no longer available, and a search on YouTube came up empty as well. I would think that’s something they would keep available, especially since dramatizations of Gaiman’s books are popular.
